name: Spot the Original
description: Identify original products and distinguish them from counterfeits
summary: Train your eye to spot authentic products! Compare original and counterfeit items, identify trademark violations, and learn to recognize genuine products. Protect consumers from fakes!

educationalInfo.brandHistory: Adidas, founded in 1949, is a German multinational corporation known for its three-stripe trademark.
educationalInfo.trademarkInfo: The three-stripe mark and trefoil logo are registered trademarks. Adidas actively protects these marks worldwide.
identificationTips: Count the stripes - must be exactly three
Verify the trefoil or three-bar logo
Look for serial number inside tongue

educationalInfo.brandHistory: Coca-Cola, created in 1886, is the world's most recognized brand. The distinctive contour bottle was introduced in 1915.
educationalInfo.trademarkInfo: The Coca-Cola script logo, contour bottle shape, and red color are all protected trademarks and trade dress.
identificationTips: Check the distinctive Spencerian script logo
Verify the iconic contour bottle shape
Look for embossed trademark on bottle
Authentic products have clear batch codes

educationalInfo.brandHistory: Colgate-Palmolive Company, founded in 1806, is an American multinational consumer products company. Colgate toothpaste has been a trusted brand for over a century.
educationalInfo.trademarkInfo: Colgate and its distinctive red oval logo are registered trademarks. The packaging design is protected trade dress.
identificationTips: Check the red oval logo carefully
Authentic tubes have clear batch and expiry dates

educationalInfo.brandHistory: Domino's Pizza, founded in 1960, is an American multinational pizza restaurant chain and one of the largest pizza delivery companies worldwide.
educationalInfo.trademarkInfo: The Domino's name and domino logo with red and blue colors are registered trademarks.
identificationTips: Check the domino dots - should be three dots
Verify red and blue color scheme
Look for proper apostrophe in Domino's

educationalInfo.brandHistory: KitKat was created in 1935 by Rowntree's of York, UK. Now owned by Nestlé, it's one of the world's most popular chocolate bars.
educationalInfo.trademarkInfo: KitKat name and logo are registered trademarks. The red packaging and four-finger shape are distinctive.

educationalInfo.brandHistory: Melody is a popular Indian chocolate toffee brand known for its unique taste and colorful packaging.
educationalInfo.trademarkInfo: Melody is a registered trademark. The distinctive packaging design and colors are protected.

educationalInfo.brandHistory: Nike, founded in 1964, is the world's leading athletic footwear and apparel brand. The Swoosh logo was designed in 1971.
educationalInfo.trademarkInfo: The Nike name and Swoosh logo are among the most valuable trademarks globally, protected in over 170 countries.
identificationTips: Check the Swoosh logo placement and proportions
Look for product code on tongue
Authentic shoes have consistent sole patterns

educationalInfo.brandHistory: Puma, founded in 1948 by Rudolf Dassler, is a German multinational corporation known for athletic and casual footwear, apparel, and accessories.
educationalInfo.trademarkInfo: The Puma name and leaping cat logo are registered trademarks protected worldwide.
identificationTips: Check the leaping cat logo details
Look for proper care and size labels

educationalInfo.brandHistory: Snickers, created in 1930 by Mars Inc., is the world's best-selling candy bar, known for its combination of nougat, caramel, peanuts, and chocolate.
educationalInfo.trademarkInfo: Snickers is a registered trademark of Mars, Incorporated. The distinctive brown packaging and logo are protected.
identificationTips: Authentic bars have proper wrapper sealing

educationalInfo.brandHistory: Starbucks, founded in 1971 in Seattle, is the world's largest coffeehouse chain, known for its distinctive green logo featuring a twin-tailed siren.
educationalInfo.trademarkInfo: Starbucks and the Siren logo are registered trademarks. The green color and circular logo design are protected trade dress.
identificationTips: Check the Siren logo details carefully
